name: caliber
content:
caliber noun
(QUALITY)
Add to word list
Add to word list
[ U ] the quality of someone or something, especially someone's ability: If teaching paid more it might attract people of (a) higher caliber. The competition entries were of such (a) high caliber that judging them was very difficult.

caliber noun
(MEASUREMENT)
[ C or U ] the width of the inside of a pipe, especially of the long cylinder-shaped part of a gun, or the width of a bullet

caliber noun
(QUALITY)
Add to word list
Add to word list
[ U ] the degree of quality or excellence of something or someone: It’s not easy to recruit high caliber personnel.
caliber noun
(MEASUREMENT)
[ C ] the width of the inside of a pipe, esp. of the long, cylindrical part of a gun, or the width of a bullet: a .22-caliber rifle
